alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 1:19PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Snow melt and reservoir releases will cause the river flows to remain high. Runoff of rain from thunderstorms into tributaries above Mason could exacerbate river flows. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Moderate flooding is occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.3 feet, Moderate flooding of lowlands to farm and pasture lands throughout the Mason Valley-Yerington area. Some low structures adjacent to river begin to flood. Several secondary and some primary roads flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:50 PM PDT Tuesday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:50 PM PDT Tuesday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 11.2 feet. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 05/18/1996. - https://www.cnrfc.noaa.gov http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Mason Bridge and Miller Lane are closed. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday.
